title: the top 200 greatest rock albums of the 1980s

title: Re: the top 200 greatest rock albums of the 1980s
content: Prince above Master of Puppets and Stevie Ray Vaughn? I just can't stand Prince, there's just something about him. And you're right, Appetite for Destruction is "THE" GNR album

title: Re: the top 200 greatest rock albums of the 1980s
content:
Grr, 80's music. I've always said that true 80's music sucks... here's proof:

From that list of 200 albums, I've removed all the albums that suck. Then removed the remaining two albums from 1980.(Doesn't count, they were made in the 70's.)
Then I removed REO, Jouney, ACDC, Pink Floyd, Don Henley/Eagles, Chicago and ZZ Top. (Because these bands do not in any way resemble 80's music. Chicago and a couple REO songs are close, but they are basically 70's stuff.)

And what's left? less than 10% of the entire 200: (Reordered as they should be...)

1. Ride The Lightning (1984)-Metallica
2. Appetite For Destruction (1987)-Guns N Roses
3. The Joshua Tree (1987)-U2
4. Master Of Puppets (1986)-Metallica
5. Hysteria (1987)-Def Leppard
6. Pyromania (1983)-Def Leppard
7. Rebel Yell (1984)-Billy Idol
8. Slippery When Wet (1987)-Bon Jovi
9. Unforgettable Fire (1984)-U2
10. ...And Justice For All (1988 )-Metallica
11. Heart (1985)-Heart
12. War (1983)-U2
13. Kill Em All (1983)-Metallica
14. Open Up and Say Ahh (1988 )-Poison
15. Eye Of The Tiger (1982)-Survivor
16. 1984 (1983)-Van Halen - 1 good song, otherwise sucks.
17. Play Deep (1985)-The Outfield - 1 good song

title: Re: the top 200 greatest rock albums of the 1980s
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]From that list of 200 albums, I've removed all the albums that suck. Then removed the remaining two albums from 1980.(Doesn't count, they were made in the 70's.)[hr][/quote]

Hooray, what a proof. You should become a scientist. I bet that you haven't heard most albums you removed at all, you even dared to delete the Iron Maiden records.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Then I removed REO, Jouney, ACDC, Pink Floyd, Don Henley/Eagles, Chicago and ZZ Top. (Because these bands do not in any way resemble 80's music.[hr][/quote]

They don't? They resemble 90's music? Or 60's music? You're kidding me right?

[quote]Quote:[hr]1. Hysteria (1987)-Def Leppard[hr][/quote]
Geez...-----------------

title: Re: the top 200 greatest rock albums of the 1980s
content: You took off The Number of the Beast? That's just evil...

title: Re: the top 200 greatest rock albums of the 1980s
content:
Thanks for the allofmp3 link!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Hooray, what a proof. You should become a scientist. I bet that you haven't heard most albums you removed at all, you even dared to delete the Iron Maiden records.[hr][/quote]
Yes, the proof is that using empirical evidence (the fact that those that suck do in fact suck [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img] ), the list is reduced to less than 10% of those that are supposed to be the decade's best.
And of course I dared. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
As far as having heard the albums, if we're talking the entire album, then no I haven't heard any of them. But I can make a pretty good judgement from 1 or 2 songs. (Or the quality of the band/artists work on other albums - e.g. Prince or Madonna.)

[quote]Quote:[hr]They don't? They resemble 90's music? Or 60's music? You're kidding me right?[hr][/quote]
70's, mostly. Maybe late 60's for the Eagles and ZZ Top.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Geez...[hr][/quote]
You're right, thank you. That was supposed to be much further down, with Ride the Lightening at the top. In fact, I'm not sure Hysteria should have made this list.

Anyway, don't take it personal. It's just an opinion of pop music. I apologize if you had any personal involvement in any of these albums.

title: Re: the top 200 greatest rock albums of the 1980s
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]As far as having heard the albums, if we're talking the entire album, then no I haven't heard any of them. But I can make a pretty good judgement from 1 or 2 songs. (Or the quality of the band/artists work on other albums - e.g. Prince or Madonna.)[hr][/quote]
No way, I could name you with ease ten bands of that list where you can't because that you heard are the most commercial pop songs on it that doesn't resemble the quality of the album

[quote]Quote:[hr]70's, mostly. Maybe late 60's for the Eagles and ZZ Top.[hr][/quote]
Rubbish, the eighties where a decade not a music genre. Any album released back then can be included in the list.

[quote]Quote:[hr]You're right, thank you. That was supposed to be much further down, with Ride the Lightening at the top. In fact, I'm not sure Hysteria should have made this list.[hr][/quote]

Not even at the bottom of the entire list, the later Def Leppard are the most horrible example of the terrible glam rock of the eighties. Something you seem to hate so much.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Anyway, don't take it personal. It's just an opinion of pop music. I apologize if you had any personal involvement in any of these albums. [hr][/quote]
Well, all right.
